We have been running a 5 instance crawl for almost 3 weeks using 
Heritrix 3.1.1. I have a few questions that I was hoping someone could 
answer.

1) Is there a way to refactor/reconfigure a started crawl to have more 
instances.  (i.e In the middle of the crawl increase the number of 
instances from 5 to some larger or smaller number)

2) Would moving the warc.gz files from the job's warc directory while 
the crawl is running to another directory cause any problems?  Does 
Heritrix use these files?  What about the files in the log directory - 
can they be moved?  We want to prevent these directories from having a 
very large number of files in them where the OS would start to have 
problems.

3) One big concern for us is invalid checkpoints.  We would like to 
verify that our checkpoints are valid.  Is it possible to copy a subset 
of a job directory to another location to use with another Heritrix job? 
  The idea would be to start a separate instance of Heritrix on separate 
machine using this copied data and the last checkpoint to verify that 
the last checkpoint is a valid checkpoint (no plans to actually crawl 
from this test instance)? If possible this could also be useful for 
debugging while still crawling with the original instance.

4) What is the best way to inject additional URIs into a started crawl? 
  We would like to inject a set of specific URIs daily and would like 
for this set of URIs to be crawled as soon as possible (if they have not 
already been crawled).

5) Although I can capture the below statistics manually, can you suggest 
a way that I can automatically generate/collect the following statistics 
from the crawl. I would like to generate this data at least once every 
24 hours and possibly as often as every hour.

a) Total size of crawled data.
b) total number of pages crawled (mime-type:  text/html).

Thanks,

David
